mention.text: the Philippine volcano that erupted Saturday after six centuries of quiet
a volcanologist at the U.S. Geological Survey office in Menlo Park
scientists in the Philippines who have been studying the volcano since April , when it first stirred
the volcano , where they should be safe from ash avalanches.
Clark Air Base , which was evacuated along with thousands of Filipinos living near the volcano.
A huge cloud of ash-laden steam
the Philippine Institute of Vulcanology and Seismology said.
Pinatubo 's primary means of causing death and destruction
hellish avalanches of hot ash -- 1,000 degrees or more
the engines of planes at the air base , Lipman said.
The volcano 's activity -- measured by seismometers detecting slight earthquakes in its molten rock plumbing system --
